item.title: Report X-2025060899
item.description:
Report X-2025060899

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OUTER BOX IS PACKAGED, MARKED AND LABELED AS ID8000 CONSUMER COMMODITY WITH THE CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING AND DECLARATION OF DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY ON 05-JUNE-2025. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X ONE QUART CONTAINERS OF XPS COOLANT. ONE IS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE.

item.title: Report E-2025060237
item.description:
Report E-2025060237

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0900et the driver was performing a walk around of his equipment and noticed that there were some liquid dripping from the trailer onto the pavement. The driver put down some absorbent and then called our emergency response number. The response team was dispatched and showed up on site at 1045et. The team assessed the situation and began gaining access to the container that was leaking. The container was found and was repacked. The container had a small pinhole in it and only 1-2gallons was released. The team then did a final cleanup with absorbents and were collected and placed in the appropriate containers for proper disposal. The clean up was completed at 1300et.

item.title: Report X-2025060897
item.description:
Report X-2025060897

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR GAS ONE BUTANE FUEL GAS CARTRIDGES, EACH AT EIGHT OUNCE CAPACITY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM FLORIDA, DROPPED OFF AT A STORE IN HIALEAH-METRO, FLORIDA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 2451R8, MFN-AMAZON, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

item.title: Report E-2025060123
item.description:
Report E-2025060123

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to the skid damaging the jug resulting in the jug leaking. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum along with used PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050363
item.description:
Report X-2025050363

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY WE RESPONDED TO ONE AIR PACKAGE DUE TO A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 8 OUNCE BOTTLE AND (1) 4 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE ACETONE, (1) 8 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE LIQUID MONOMER (UN1247 METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER STABILIZED) AND (1) 1 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE OPI BOND AID (UN1173 ETHYL ACETATE). THERE ARE ASSORTED NAIL SALON RELATED PRODUCTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THERE IS ALSO ONE GELISH GO FILE HYBRID ELECTRIC FILE WITH AN INSTALLED LITHIUM-ION BATTERY, 36 WATT HOURS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE UPS STORE WITH A CONTACT RETURN NAME OF UNIQUE FLANEGIN.
